data.text:
Admit it, most people when they found out that Shori's new solo is called 風景画, they all agreed on one thing; Shori is indeed a grandpa lol XD

But this kind of title and song is so 'Shori'. And it sounds good so I have no complains lol

This time the theme of Shori's solo is 'shitsuren' that means 'broken heart' or unrequited love'.

I personally like the song, from the music to the lyric. I think among all the songlyrics that Shori wrote, I like this one and ikiteyo the most. And I wonder who broke your heart until you wrote a lyric like that, Shori? lol

From Sexy Zone's 6th Album "PAGES"

Release Date: 2019.03.13 (our beloved Kento's birthday)

風景画

Lyricist: 佐藤勝利

Composer: 藤野翔之

[Kanji]

何気ない日常を切り取った絵画

名画と思うのはいつになるんだろう

どうかそんな風景は空想と気づけたら

ほらそこに在る日常が輝きだし始める空へと

出会いの糸から溢(こぼ)れた色たちは

その前の色には戻れない

幾重にも紡がれた糸を辿れば

君がいる だといいな…

空は青い久しぶりに見上げたな

この景色はいつまで続いてくんだろう

だっていつも下向いて日常て気づけない

寂(さび)しいかな偽りつづけ雨降りだし始める此処へと

ついた嘘の数だけ菫(すみれ)を咲かそう

たかがって疑って無視せずに

互いの言葉を聞かずに僕たちは

今いる なんでかな…

あの雨もいつかまた咲かすんだ

さよならと言わず気づいてよ

この蕾を

雨が止んだのに傘を閉じないのは

泣き顔が君にさ見えるから

じゃあねと言った側からもう僕たちは

1人だね

早くして… 離れてよ…

早くして… 離れてよ…

そばにいて

[Romaji]

Nanigenai nichijou wo kiritotta kaiga

Meiga to omou no wa itsu ni narundarou

Douka sonna fuukei wa kuusou to kidzuketara

Hora soko ni aru nichijou ga kagayaki dashi hajimeru sora he to

Deai no ito kara koboreta irotachi wa

Sono mae no iro ni wa modorenai

Ikuenimo tsumugareta ito wo tadoreba

Kimi ga iru dato ii na…

Sora wa aoi hisashiburi ni miageta na

Kono keshiki wa itsumade tsudzuitekun darou

Datte itsumo shita muite nichijou tte kidzukenai

Sabishii ka na itsuwari tsudzuke ame furidashi hajimeru koko he to

Tsuita uso no kazu dake sumire wo sakasou

Takagatte utagatte mushi sezu ni

Tagai no kotoba wo kikazu ni bokutachi wa

Ima iru nande ka na…

Ano ame mo itsuka mata sakasunda

Sayonara to iwazu kidzuite yo

Kono tsubomi wo

Ame ga yanda no ni kasa wo tojinai no wa

Nakigao ga kimi ni sa mieru kara

Jaa ne to itta soba kara mou bokutachi wa

Hitorida ne

Hayaku shite… hanarete yo…

Hayaku shite… hanarete yo…

Soba ni ite

[Translation]

A painting that cuts off daily life

When will it be thought of as a masterpiece?

If you think such a landscape is a fantasy

You see, to the sky where the everyday life begins to shine

The colors that spilled from the thread of encounter

It can't go back to its previous color

If you find the threads that piled up in layers

It would be really nice if you're there...

Look up at the blue sky for the first time in a long time

I wonder how long this view will last?

Because I always look down and never realize my everyday life

To the place where the lonely lies continue and rain starts pouring

Let's bloom as many violet as the number of lies I've made

Don't ignore the doubt*

We who don't listen to each other words

We are here now, I wonder why...

That rain too, it will bloom again someday

I notice it even without saying goodbye

This flower bud**

I didn't close my umbrella even though it has stopped raining

Because you will see my crying face

I said goodbye from the side, we are already

We are alone

Hurry up... leave me...

Hurry up... leave me...

Stay with me

======================================== ======================================

NOTES:

It's quite hard to translate this song. If you find the (*) beside a line, it means;

(*) I think I missed something, I really can't find the right words to translate 'takagatte' so I only translated the other words.

(**) Tsubomi means flower bud, flower before it blooms. It's not like I'm doubting my own translation on this line, but I don't know, I just think it's not poetic at all, and I hope people will still get the feel this song has that Shori trying to tell us.

Shori said, when he started writing this song, the first words that came to him was that "tsuita uso no kazu dake sumire wo sakasou (let's bloom as many violet as the number of lies I've made)" and I personally and honestly think that this line is the most beautiful one in this song :)

No copyrights infringement intended. Got the picture from gugel. Kanji from mojim as always, romaji and translation by me, so don't claim it as yours. If you spot any mistakes, feel free to tell me, I'm still learning so your opinion can really help me improve my Japanese :)

You can use the lyrics (romaji and/or translation) to sub video, or retranslate them to whatever language you like, but please credit this journal. Thank you :)
